topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5338aefb6368727088fd0000#post_5338aefb6368727088fd0000
Tl:dr of puella magi madoka magica; Protagonists just want to go out and be normal teens and date the characters they like, the antagonist is one of the biggest irredeemable fucking assholes in cinema.

At the end of the third movie we're supposed to feel bad for the antagonist, but the reaction everyone gets instead is "FUCK YEAH! Torture that little shit!"

That could be the alternate title of the franchise: "Yes the antagonist gets what's coming to him.  Break out the champagne."
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5338b3946368724986070100#post_5338b3946368724986070100
It's called "blue/orange morals".  The immediate problem with this is that cause he constantly hits them over the head with the idea that their morals don't mean shit that throws any redemption out the window.  He states multiple times that he thinks that emotions are a mental illness and makes 0 attempts to try to understand how humans could coexist with emotions and falls back on the "emotions are a mental illness" belief whenever evidence to the contrary is presented.

If someone were to come up to you and state you have a mental illness several times therefore you're wrong about everything morality wise then whenever any evidence is presented that refutes their statement saying that you're wrong cause you have mental illness and therefore any evidence to the contrary is invalid would you say that makes someone a good person or even a logical person?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5338b75a636872738e600000#post_5338b75a636872738e600000
Obviously, but he doesn't make any attempt at figuring out what he did wrong.  His reaction was that of someone believing they can't be wrong and instead believe everyone else is wrong so best to find out how to stop people from being wrong.  He's nothing more than a individual who goes to no end to try and prove that they're infallible under every circumstance.

If anything he's insane cause continuously doing the same thing over and over expecting different results is insanity.  (Vaas says hi)

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5339a7e86368721b50e10000#post_5339a7e86368721b50e10000
I don't know honestly.

I originally didn't want to see the show or the movies cause of that but the plot twist I went, "didn't see that coming".
spoiler of what the show is actually about: [spoiler]They're all actually soylent green and aliens are harvesting them like cattle for the slaughter.  The entire series can be summarized as one girl finds out they're all on the chopping block to become soylent green so she abuses her powers over and over to try and stop her girlfriend from being next; as a result they think she's the bad person cause they don't believe her.[/spoiler]

topics.body:
So I'm at the library, and some sixth graders across from me are creating online profiles for some MMO. One of them asked the other for a creative username, and he responded "Yolotroll 17. Not Yolotroll20, because that's hard to remember."

I feel like I should tell them, but that's not really my style.
